description:
go.crypto/ssh: allow zero sized window adjustments

The RFC doesn't prohibit zero sized window adjustments and
there is evidence of well known clients using them in the
wild.

messages.text:
Hello agl@golang.org, kardianos@gmail.com, gustav.paul@gmail.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.crypto

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=f5b249bd8544&repo=crypto ***

go.crypto/ssh: allow zero sized window adjustments

The RFC doesn't prohibit zero sized window adjustments and
there is evidence of well known clients using them in the
wild.

R=agl, kardianos, gustav.paul
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6209082

Thank you. Will land this later today. 

On 22/05/2012, at 1:17, agl@golang.org wrote:

> LGTM
> 
> http://codereview.appspot.com/6209082/

Are you happy for me to submit this in place of your CL ?

On Sat, May 19, 2012 at 12:14 PM,  <kardianos@gmail.com> wrote:
> LGTM
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/6209082/

Hello agl@golang.org, kardianos@gmail.com, gustav.paul@gmail.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.
I'll wait for agl for feedback from the server side.

subject: code review 6209082: go.crypto/ssh: allow zero sized window adjustments
